title: muliyadi227
author: muliyadi227
created_time: November 12, 2023, 09:30:53 PMLast edit: November 12, 2023, 09:42:49 PM by muliyadi227
content: How long has your account been registered with Bitcointalk? Maybe this is not so important to ask or state. However, I'm sure there will be a sense of pride if we are recognized or acknowledge that with our Bitcointalk account we have been registered on the Bitcointalk.org forum for quite a long time. And that can prove that we have been following Bitcoin for a long time and are not new to Bitcoin.My own account has been registered since November 21, 2017, 03:38:32 PM, At that time I knew about Bitcoin and the Bitcoin Forum through friends who like to make money from the Internet.How about you guys? Is There Anything Older Than My Account? And how did you know about Bitcoin at that time? And When does your Bitcoin transaction start? and for what?

comments.author: Hatchy
comments.body: Is this thread really necessary mate? I seriously don't see any reason why you want to know when each users account was created relating to Bitcoin. You can just check it out yourself by clicking on their profile.

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: Not necessary and not useful.To know when an account is registered, click on the user's profile link to see the details.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Having an old registered account on this forum does not prove how knowledgeable the person is about bitcoin. Many people have created accounts even since 2011 and have been inactive on the forum and don't even know much about the progress of bitcoin. There are also many people who have not even visited this forum or have an account here yet but have been around the blockchain for quite some time now. What I'm saying is this: the account creation date does not really matter around here; what people are known and recognised for is the knowledge they carry and experience they have about bitcoin. Some people have been here just a little over a year, but their contributions to the forum and blockchain have been incredible, and it's what they could be remembered for, not by when they created their account. Most times, maturity is not measured by age but by what someone has upstairs.

comments.author: muliyadi227
comments.body: Yes it is not Necessary,  and I said it on the thread. But I just wanna know how you know about this Forum, and especially how do you know about Bitcoin?

comments.author: KingsDen
comments.body: Quote from: muliyadi227 on November 12, 2023, 09:30:53 PMMy own account has been registered since November 21, 2017, 03:38:32 PM, At that time I knew about Bitcoin and the Bitcoin Forum through friends who like to make money from the Internet.How about you guys? Is There Anything Older Than My Account? And how did you know about Bitcoin at that time?Ok!I understand you very well. You just want a medium to tell us that despite that you are a newbie with 2 merits that you have known this forum for the past 5 or 6yrs. Congratulations.But then, people are not recognised based on how long they have been in the forum, but how impactful they are the little time they spend here. Look at this account - PowerGlove, he is barely 1 year and few months but he has impacted positively to the forum.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Sometimes I wonder what was the person thinking before they concluded to make a post public? If you had ask when was the first time users made their first transaction with bitcoin it would have been better than asking about something you can quietly go to their profile page to check… And since you want to know my account was created in the 90s before the creation of bitcoin itself.

comments.body: Quote from: muliyadi227 on November 12, 2023, 09:37:57 PMYes it is not Necessary,  and I said it on the thread. Such a grand way to announce your presence back on the forum, don't you think?.You stated it's not important to state or ask yet you went along and did it anyway. ItQuoteHow about you guys? Is There Anything Older Than My Account? And how did you know about Bitcoin at that time? And When does your Bitcoin transaction start? and for what I'm tempted to believe you were feeling sleepy while typing this but if I were to answer your question on if  anything  is older than your account, the answer should be Bitcoin.

comments.author: PytagoraZ
comments.body: I don't want to tell you, you can look at my profile tab, are you too busy so you need to ask something that you can find out by looking at the member profile tab?Apart from that, you also make this question in capital letters because maybe you feel this question is very important so that everyone can see your question. Come on, surely you have other questions that are more logical than questions like this

comments.author: m2017
comments.body: Quote from: KingsDen on November 12, 2023, 09:39:40 PMQuote from: muliyadi227 on November 12, 2023, 09:30:53 PMMy own account has been registered since November 21, 2017, 03:38:32 PM, At that time I knew about Bitcoin and the Bitcoin Forum through friends who like to make money from the Internet.How about you guys? Is There Anything Older Than My Account? And how did you know about Bitcoin at that time?Ok!I understand you very well. You just want a medium to tell us that despite that you are a newbie with 2 merits that you have known this forum for the past 5 or 6yrs. Congratulations.But then, people are not recognised based on how long they have been in the forum, but how impactful they are the little time they spend here. Look at this account - PowerGlove, he is barely 1 year and few months but he has impacted positively to the forum.Impactful in this case includes a combination of other definitions, such as noticeable and useful. The more contributions made to the forum, the more influential this account is in the eyes of the community.The age of the account may have absolutely nothing to do with the above, but the older the account and the longer the period of activity, the higher the likelihood that this account will be influential. Such an account may or may not have extensive knowledge about the bitcoin. It all depends on the personal zeal of the account owner to acquire new knowledge.In fact, the time spent online (registration date) is just a counter in the account profile. Nothing more.An indicator that an account is not new to questions about bitcoin can only be its answers / posts. And even better - his actions, that is, the practical application of knowledge about the bitcoin.

comments.author: Mate2237
comments.body: Quote from: muliyadi227 on November 12, 2023, 09:37:57 PMYes it is not Necessary,  and I said it on the thread. But I just wanna know how you know about this Forum, and especially how do you know about Bitcoin?Op lock this thread because nothing is here to discuss. And why do want to know the date and the duration of my account in the forum? And if you want to know the duration which I have registered my account in the forum then you can check my profile and see the registration date and know the period or the length of the account in the forum. Op if I understand your topic and the opening statement and your bolded sentence here, telling you my account registration date is very far from know more about the forum.If you want to know more about the forum from active users then you have to restructure the subject and content because what you are saying here and the content plus the topic two different things. And that is by the way. Op please just click my profile then you see my registration date. That is very simple . There should be no argument for that.
